message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.NA, cs.SI

This paper deals with the problem of decomposing a data matrix into a low-rank component and a sparse component in a known dictionary. This problem is relevant in several areas of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), information theory (cs.IT), computer vision (cs.CV), numerical analysis (cs.NA), and signal processing (cs.SI). The paper presents a convex demixing method for solving this problem and provides a unified analysis that covers both undercomplete and overcomplete dictionary cases. The empirical evaluations presented in the paper also suggest that the proposed method can be useful in various applications, which further supports the relevance of this work to multiple sub-categories of computer science.
